Deployment

Quick deploy allows you to easily deploy your projects when you push to source control. When you push to your master branch, Forge will pull your latest code from source control, install Composer dependencies, and run your migrations.

Deployment Trigger URL

Using a custom Git service, or want a service like Travis CI to run your tests before your application is deployed to Forge? It's simple. When you commit fresh code, or when your continous integration service finishes testing your application, instruct the service to make a GET or POST request to the following URL. Making a request to this URL will trigger your Forge deployment script:

https://forge.laravel.com/servers/11433/sites/23810/deploy/http?token=GAqs3E8mENPP2GpTleSXzAfFZdbnvRLLogWyg7CC

Uninstall Repository

Uninstalling a repository will reset the site back to its original state, which is a simple PHP information display.
Here you may easily start as many Artisan queue workers as you like. The workers will automatically be monitored by Supervisor, and will be restarted if they crash. All workers will start automatically if the server is rebooted.

New Worker

Whoops! There were some problems with your input.

Here you may add Laravel environment variables. These variables allow you to keep sensitive configuration out of your source code repository. All variables will be available via the getenv PHP function, and will also be added as fastcgi_param directives to your site's Nginx configuration.

Create Signing Request

Whoops! There were some problems with your input.

The first step in setting up a new SSL certificate is generating a certificate signing request (CSR). You can then use this CSR to purchase a certificate from any vendor you wish.

server {
    listen 80;
    server_name .api.neartutors.com;
    
    root /home/forge/api.neartutors.com/public;
    # FORGE SSL (DO NOT REMOVE!)
    # ssl_certificate;
    # ssl_certificate_key;
    index index.html index.htm index.php;
    charset utf-8;
    location / {
        add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' 'http://neartutors.com';
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$query_string;
    }
    location = /favicon.ico { access_log off; log_not_found off; }
    location = /robots.txt  { access_log off; log_not_found off; }
    access_log off;
    error_log  /var/log/nginx/api.neartutors.com-error.log error;
    error_page 404 /index.php;
    location ~ \.php$ {
        fastcgi_param db_password "tbWMZLnFO8iL6pRLcXtf";
        fastcgi_param db_username "forge";
        fastcgi_param db_name "blueoceandb";
        fastcgi_param db_host "localhost";
        fastcgi_split_path_info ^(.+\.php)(/.+)$;
